definition: to abuse roundly
broken/damaged/worn out/lousy/rotten/to break, split or cleave/to get rid of/to destroy/to break with/to defeat/to capture (a city etc)/to expose the truth of
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to scold/to abuse/to curse/CL:通[tong4],頓|顿[dun4]

sentences.english: He hit his head as he stood up and cursed loudly.
sentences.chinese: 他站起來時撞了頭，便破口大罵。

sentences.english: The driver was slanging a pedestrian who had got in his way.
sentences.chinese: 那司機破口大罵擋他的路的行人。

sentences.english: I can catch the last shout abuse, or knees to detain him.
sentences.chinese: 我可以追過去破口大罵，或者雙膝跪地挽留他。

sentences.english: She shouted abuse without any restraint.
Li Qiang's in the mind denounces aboveboard, on the mouth but guest the respectful spirit ground say.

definition: to damn/to curse/to revile
to give vent to anger
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
red in the face/extremely angry
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to contradict (elders or superiors)
stern voice
to burst into tears/to sob loudly/to bawl
to yell/hubbub
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
to come to blows/to paw/to grope/to get fresh
to swear while talking/to be foul-mouthed
to hoot
